## Demo Login

- Added a new `demo-login` section in `src/pages/demo.astro` with a glassmorphism login card so partners can enter issued demo credentials before exploring other sections.
- Introduced scoped styles for the two-column layout, form fields, and support links, matching Frog8 typography, spacing, and responsive rules down to mobile breakpoints.
- Included accessible form semantics (labels, helper text, focus states) plus quick paths to request credentials or reach support.

Next: Preview the page locally to confirm the new section blends with the existing flow and try the form at mobile widths.

_**User (2025-11-10 05:47Z)**_

The demo login page is not showing when I open /demo page

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Troubleshooting missing login on demo page**

I'm thinking the login section might not appear because the site wasn't rebuilt after adding it—maybe the user is viewing an old static build or the dev server didn't reload properly. I'll suggest confirming they run `npm run dev` for a fresh development build or `npm run build` if serving static files, and verify they’re checking the updated page locally rather than a cached or outdated version.</details></think>

---

Looks like the updated markup is in `src/pages/demo.astro`, but the browser is still serving an older build. Astro only picks up filesystem changes after a rebuild or dev restart, so the new login section won’t appear until the site is recompiled.

Quick fix:
- If you’re running the dev server, stop it and restart with `npm run dev`.
- If you’re viewing the static `dist` output, run `npm run build`, then re-open the refreshed `dist/demo/index.html` (or redeploy).

Once the fresh build loads, the `demo-login` section shows up right after the hero block.

## Demo Access Gate

- Added a dedicated login experience at `src/pages/demo-login.astro` featuring the glassmorphism form, support CTAs, and inline validation; successful sign-in stores a `frog8DemoAccess` session with 30‑minute (or 12‑hour “remember me”) expiry and then redirects to `/demo`.
- Updated `src/pages/demo.astro` to check that session on page load; missing or expired tokens now send visitors back to the login screen.

`F8-DEMO-ACCESS` is seeded as the default key—swap it for your actual credential when ready.

To verify, restart the dev server (`npm run dev`) and walk through `/demo-login → /demo`. If you need to revoke access, clear the browser’s local storage for `frog8payments.com`.

---

Updated the login screen so it lands center-stage without a scroll marathon:

- Trimmed the hero copy and replaced the card stack with a tight bullet list (`intro-list`) to cut vertical bulk.
- Gave `.demo-login-hero` and the container a viewport-height layout (`min-height: calc(100vh - 6rem)`, flex centering) so the form and intro sit mid-screen on desktop.
- Tweaked spacing/responsive rules so the layout stays snug on larger displays but relaxes on tablets/phones.

Result: on modern desktops you hit `/demo-login` and everything fits on the first fold. Let me know if you want a pop-up/overlay variant instead.

footer is also not required in login pages!

Date.now() + 1000 * 60 * 60 * 12 : Date.now() + 1000 * 60 * 30;\r\n        const session = { email, issuedAt: Date.now(), expiresAt };\r\n\r\n        try {\r\n          window.localStorage.setItem(sessionKey, JSON.stringify(session));\r\n        } catch {\r\n          showStatus(\&quot;We could not store your session. Please enable cookies/local storage and retry.\&quot;);\r\n          return;\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        showStatus(\&quot;Access verified. Redirecting to the Demo Studio…\&quot;, \&quot;success\&quot;);\r\n        window.setTimeout(() =&gt; {\r\n          window.location.replace(redirectPath);\r\n        }, 600);\r\n      });\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n&lt;/script&gt;\r\n\r\n&lt;style&gt;\r\n  .demo-login-hero {\r\n    padding-block: clamp(3rem, 6vh, 5rem);\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  .login-container {\r\n    min-height: calc(100vh - 6rem);\r\n User decision: **accepted**

Status: **completed**

</tool-use>

---

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Ensuring DOM elements exist before scripting**

I'm working on making sure the logout button exists in the DOM before attaching event listeners, since the script currently runs before the button is parsed and causes missed listener attachment. To fix this, I'll wrap the handler attachment inside a DOMContentLoaded event listener or check document.readyState to attach the listener at the right time. I'll update the script so it waits for the DOM to be ready before trying to find and add events to the button, positioning this after any redirect logic but before script closing.</details></think>

---

Added a “Log Out” control on `/demo` and wired up the session clear:

- Injected a glass-morphism toolbar at the top of the hero with a live session indicator and `Log Out` button.
- Inline script now clears the `frog8DemoAccess` token and sends users back to `/demo-login`; it waits for DOM ready so the handler always binds.
- Scoped styling gives the toolbar a brand-aligned ghost button and responsive adjustments (stacks on tablets/phones).

Ready to test by logging in, opening `/demo`, and hitting “Log Out” to confirm the redirect.

_**User (2025-11-10 05:47Z)**_

See, This side of the website(demo/ demo login page) is for investors and potential clients! I need them to be amazed with each and every part of the website!

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Considering potential enhancements**</details></think>

---

Totally on board—this flow has to radiate polish. Here’s how I’d take the `/demo-login → /demo` journey from already solid to “wow” for investors:

### Login Experience
- **Immersive background:** Add a subtle animated gradient grid or softly moving light streaks behind the glass card—keeps load fast but instantly feels premium.
- **Micro-interactions:**  
  - Inputs glow with a low-latency pulse on focus; success/failure states animate in gracefully.  
  - On submit, button morphs into a spinner with “Verifying access…” text before snapping back or redirecting.
- **3D accent:** Consider a looping Three.js asset—maybe the Frog8 orb/logo rotating slowly with parallax tied to cursor/device tilt.

### Demo Studio Landing
- **Session toolbar upgrade:** Show logged-in email with a mini avatar state, plus countdown until auto-expire that animates subtly. Keeps the page feeling secure and considerate.
- **Hero animation:** Layer a dynamic mesh or particle field behind the metrics, synced with scroll or pointer—even just 30fps CSS-driven motion can impress.
- **Interactive cards:** Give the demo cards hover lifts, gradient wipes, and quick peeks (e.g., when hovered, the video thumbnail animates or stats tick upward).

### Narrative Flow Enhancements
- **Investor highlights ribbon:** A horizontal ticker or chips calling out metrics like “45M journeys”, “99.99% uptime”, “Trusted by Mumbai Metro” sliding in—instantly communicates credibility.
- **Testimonials or quotes:** Drop in a glass card with a quote from a partner/CXO, maybe with signature and brand logo.

### Navigation & Cohesion
- **Guarded routes:** Since this is a private funnel, add gentle transitions between `/demo-login` and `/demo` (fade/slide) so they feel like part of a single cinematic experience.
- **Loading states:** Preload hero assets with a branded loader so there’s no jarring blank wait.

Let me know which of these resonate (or if you have other inspirations—screenshots/dribbble links welcome). I can knock out a focused implementation next, starting with motion/design bits you prioritize most.

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Adding conditional logout button in navigation**

I’m planning to add a logout button next to the Navbar header only on the demo page by detecting the route with `Astro.url.pathname`. I’ll insert the button markup conditionally inside the Navigation component and create matching CSS styles for desktop and mobile views, ensuring the script hooks properly and the button is accessible without affecting other pages.</details></think>

---

Logout now rides shotgun with the navbar on `/demo`—the button is rendered from `Navigation.astro` only when the current path starts with `/demo`, so other pages stay unchanged. Styling matches the glass header, and the existing logic on `demo.astro` still clears the session and redirects. On mobile the button hides (to avoid crowding beside the burger); if you want a mobile-friendly placement later we can extend the slide-out menu.

---

### Demo Login — White Theme Refresh

- Wrapped the page in `login-surface` with a bright gradient background so the entire experience feels airy and premium for investors.
- Swapped the glass panel styling to a light variant (`glass-light` + `white-card`) with softened shadows, while keeping the Frog8 lime accents.
- Tuned typography and form colors for dark-on-light readability, updated input focus states, and re-colored helper/success/error states to match the new palette.
- Brand mark now sits on a translucent white pill, keeping the logo crisp against the lighter canvas.

Give it a spin on `/demo-login`; if you’d like additional motion cues or alternate imagery for the light mode, happy to explore.

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Refining professional branding and removing "demo" wording**

I'm preparing to overhaul the login and showcase pages by removing any instances of "demo" to craft a polished, investor-focused experience. This includes updating titles, headings, call-to-actions, status messages, and access keys across `demo-login.astro`, `demo.astro`, and navigation components—while carefully renaming IDs, anchors, and CSS classes where needed to maintain consistency and reflect names like "Experience Studio," "Partner Access," or "Showcase." ---

### Investor-Focused Access Flow

- Reframed `src/pages/demo-login.astro` as a white-label partner portal: refreshed hero copy (no “demo” mentions), centered logo, updated CTA text, and swapped credentials messaging/subjects (`F8-STUDIO-ACCESS`, `frog8StudioAccess`). Success copy now promises a redirect to the Partner Studio.
- Elevated `src/pages/demo.astro` into a partner showcase: new page title/description, “Partner Experience Suite” hero, solution-focused preview cards, “Solution Experiences” gallery with renamed classes (experience-card/media/etc.), and updated engagement/CTA language. Toolbar + scripts now reference the new `frog8StudioAccess` token.
- Adjusted navigation labels (`Navigation.astro`, `MobileMenu.jsx`) so `/demo` appears as “Experience” across desktop and mobile menus.

No lint issues. Next steps: restart the dev server, log in with the new access key, and confirm `/demo` reflects the refreshed content and logout still clears the updated session key.

---

Both CTA buttons now sit on a single horizontal row in each card:

- Wrapped the two links per experience inside `.experience-action-row`, a flex container.
- Added matching styles so the buttons stay side by side while still wrapping cleanly on smaller screens.
- Kept `experience-actions` as the overall footer with `margin-top: auto`, so alignment with the other card stays intact.

Reload `/demo` to see the console/platform buttons line up perfectly.
